smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function onCreate is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function onCreate is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function setMode appears to be too complex.
The function restoreUserData appears to be too complex.
The function updateStats appears to be too complex.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function initDic is nested too deeply.
Function restoreUserData is nested too deeply.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class QuizzActivity is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class KaquiDb is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'QuizzActivity' with '29' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'KaquiDb' with '18' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'LearningDbView' with '18' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function updateStats has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught
smells.description: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

instances.message: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.
Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionThrown
smells.description: Thrown exception is too generic. Prefer throwing project specific exceptions to handle error cases.

instances.message: RuntimeException is a too generic Exception. Prefer throwing specific exceptions that indicate a specific error case.

RuntimeException is a too generic Exception. Prefer throwing specific exceptions that indicate a specific error case.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: org.kaqui.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
org.kaqui.model.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.widget.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
org.kaqui.model.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
org.kaqui.data.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: CollapsibleIfStatements
smells.description: Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.

instances.message: Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses around the lambda ({ it == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ getProbabilityDataStage1(now, probaParams, it) }) are unnecessary and can be removed.

Parentheses in (1.0 / 10.0 *
                                    Math.min(daysSinceCorrect / 2.0 /
                                            (probaParams.daysBegin + (probaParams.daysEnd - probaParams.daysBegin) * previousLongScore), 1.0)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 1.0 / 10.0 *
                                    Math.min(daysSinceCorrect / 2.0 /
                                            (probaParams.daysBegin + (probaParams.daysEnd - probaParams.daysBegin) * previousLongScore), 1.0)
Parentheses in (daysEnd * 0.5) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: daysEnd * 0.5
Parentheses in (disabledCount.toFloat() / total) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: disabledCount.toFloat() / total
Parentheses in (stats.bad.toFloat() / total) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: stats.bad.toFloat() / total
Parentheses in (stats.meh.toFloat() / total) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: stats.meh.toFloat() / total
Parentheses in (stats.good.toFloat() / total) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: stats.good.toFloat() / total

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.
